title: A Program to Enhance Social Studies History and Culture Exhibition Learning Effects Using Digital Learning Sheets

context.prior_knowledge: Basic understanding of exhibition-based or digital learning tools, comprehension of core social studies concepts (history, geography, culture, politics, and economics), and awareness of fundamental rights and responsibilities as a citizen
context.additional_context: Project-based assessment-driven social studies inquiry program (analysis, expression, collaboration, critical thinking) in smartphone-based learning environments. Includes community-linked field research activities emphasizing local relevance.

learning_goals: Learners enhance learning motivation by ≥20% and strengthen cultural understanding as citizens using digital learning sheets linked to social studies history/culture exhibition content.

Learners analyze application cases of the "sensory exploration principle" in digital learning sheets, apply them to social studies projects (e.g., local culture research, historical site visits), and write inquiry reports considering geographical and political contexts.

Learners develop self-assessment checklists within one week that include ≥3 evaluation criteria (e.g., conceptual clarity, systematicity of research, data accuracy, cultural sensitivity) to measure cognitive (conceptual understanding) and psychomotor (field research) learning outcomes in social studies.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
